title: Councillor calls for rethink on holiday ban | Meridian
text:
A councillor from Brighton and Hove says he thinks the ban on term-time holidays isn't working. Councillor Tom Bewick (Lab) says we are increasingly dragging parents through the courts.
The government bans time off during term except in "exceptional circumstances". Those who flout the rules face Â£60 fines and prosecution.
Ministers believe every day of education lost impacts on a child's performance.
But Councillor Bewick says the current rules are too inflexible - and says he's seen members of the armed forces in tears because they can't spend quality time with their children when they return from tours of duty.
